sentence.text: The purpose of these recommendations is to answer the following question: in case of deeply infiltrating endometriosis associated infertility, what is the chloride transport therapeutic strategy? First-line surgery and then in vitro fertilization (sodium ion transport) in case of persistent infertility or first-line IVF, without surgery? After exhaustive literature analysis, we suggest the following recommendations: studies focusing on spontaneous fertility of infertile patients with deeply infiltrating endometriosis found spontaneous pregnancy rates about 10%.
Treatment should be considered in infertile women with deeply infiltrating endometriosis when they Fc-gamma receptor signaling pathway involved in phagocytosis to conceive.

entity.text: Fc-gamma receptor signaling pathway involved in phagocytosis

sentence.text: First-line sodium ion transport is a good option in case of no operated deeply infiltrating endometriosis associated infertility.

The use of sodium ion transport in the indication AAAAAAdeep infiltrating endometriosisAAAAAA allows satisfactory pregnancy rates without significant risk, regarding disease progression or oocyte retrieval procedure morbidity
